an6.106:1.1: “Mendicants, you should give up these three cravings and three conceits.
an6.106:1.2: What three cravings should you give up?
an6.106:1.3: Craving for sensual pleasures, craving for existence, and craving for nonexistence.
an6.106:1.4: These are the three cravings you should give up.
an6.106:1.5: What three conceits should you give up?
an6.106:1.6: Conceit, inferiority complex, and superiority complex.
an6.106:1.7: These are the three conceits you should give up.
an6.106:1.8: When a mendicant has given up these three cravings and these three conceits
an6.106:1.9: they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, cast off the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
